Reviews.Title: “return visit”
Reviews.Author: female-tourist
Reviews.Content: The Miramar is a bit pricy but this was a return visit and when you know the standard you can expect, I chose it. This is away from the centre and quieter. Although on a busy main road, there was no traffic noise. Clarke Quay is about a 20 minute stroll along the riverbank - very pleasant. I arived after midnight, greeted by pleasant staff and a very quick check-in. My room was very large, pleasant and equipped with fridge, coffee maker and room safe. Buffet breakfast was not included for me, and offered a good range of Asian and European foods. I did not like their very strong coffee and have receivd a written apology from the manager saying they will consider changing their coffee brand. Singapore is a good stop-over point when flying from Australia to England and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: ytravel18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Miramar for one weekend when we were in Singapore. The hotel is very reasonable for this type of hotels. The room is not fancy, but it is comfy and has sufficient amenities. I would have to say the shower is very good. If you're looking for a luxury hotel, then this is not for you. However if you're looking for a place to rest while exploring Singapore then this is the one for you considering how pricey all Singapore hotels are. It is also located near Clarke Quay where there are some restaurants and bars. If not Orchard Road is a 5 min cab ride away. A note to those who are driving, the hotel offers free parking to guests. Just ask for the voucher when you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good middle-of-the-road hotel, with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: SylvieRamonaBluebell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Miramar for a short getaway as part of a package from Escape Travel. I paid $200 a night but stayed 4 nights for the price of three. Pros: -most of the staff were very friendly (except for one tour booking person who was really quite rude and one bellman who couldn't care less) -most bell staff and desk personnel were very efficient -they let me check in very early after an early am arrival...with no extra charge -there is a shower and change room you can use free if you have a late flight -there is a mall within ten minutes' walking distance Cons: -The 'deluxe' rooms are definitely not four-star, as the Miramar bills itself (although I understand the 'premium' rooms are a bit better)-the rooms are worn around the edges and in need of some renovations -the housekeeping was so-so (note to staff--you need to clean under the rim of the toilet bowl too...eww) -despite what some others have said, this place is not that central...it is not that close to any major points of interest. It is a hike to get anywhere on foot, and there is no MRT station nearby. There is a bus station outside the door of the hotel, but if you don't already know your way around it is a bit of a chore to figure out. -i asked for a late check out as I was going on a tour all morning, and they said the best they could do was one extra hour...for a charge. All up, although the Miramar definitely has its drawbacks, there is a pretty good vibe here and some of the staff were outstanding. If it had some upgrading and the prices were just a bit lower, I would stay here again. Now that I know the lay of the land though, I will probably be looking for a more modern, more central hotel the next time I come to Singapore. Grade: C+

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Buch78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Miramar for 3 nights, 4 days in January at the beginning of a trip to New Zealand. We arrived at about 9 am after a 12 hour flight from the UK. The reception staff were most helpful and told us we would have our room as soon as possible. This was at about 10.30am. We were delighted at the short wait and were able to shower, change and get out to explore the city well before lunchtime. Our twin room was spacious, looking out onto the main road but as we were 13 storeys high the busy traffic did not bother us. The bathroom was spotless, with new towels each day. Off the lobby there is a restaurant where we had a buffet breakfast each morning. An amazing variety of food to choose from, more than enough to keep you going all day. One tip --- if you like tea for breakfast take a t-bag with you as the tea in the pots is quite weak and English breakfast tea bags are not readily available. Twice we had a snack there in the middle of the day, the toasted sanwiches were good! Immediately outside the hotel there is a bus stop where you can catch the city tour buses. There are plenty of taxis which the concierge will call for you. They are very reasonable. Close by, to the right as you exit the front of the hotel, is a petrol station with a small shop for things like extra water. We booked 2 evening trips via the concierge...the night safari at the zoo... great, and the night tour of the city to include a visit to Raffles. We enjoyed the second but wished there had been time to look at the city at night as the lights were fabulous. Unfortunately the coach kept moving from one stop to the next and this wasn't possible. Photos taken trough the window of a moving coach at night do not come out very well! Our flight leaving Singapore was not until the evening. We asked at reception if we could keep our room until 3pm. We were prepared to pay but they allowed us to stay until 2.30pm free of charge. This allowed us to visit the Botanic Gardens in the morning and have a shower before waiting for our airport pick up. We would reccommend this hotel to anyone passing through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: revkev
Reviews.Content: stayed in singapore at the miramar hotel for 3 nights prior to a cruise. hotel was on havelock road and over looked the singapore river a 5 min walk from clark quay. hotel was excellent for the location, comfort and amenities. first visit to singapore and with so much to see, hop on hop off bus stopped right outside hotel this was good value. could also easily walk to most city centre attractions from here.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaPinball
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a stay 3, pay 2 promotion, and also the cheap rates on offer from the British airways website. All up, room was Au$110/night, without breakfast. Great value in an expensive city. Room was good, hotel was good, staff very good. hints 1) stay away from any hotel extras -food, drink, Internet, all very expensive. Beer at bar is Au$15. 2). Don't use hotel shuttle to Orcard/Chinatown. Bus 133 will get you to Orchard much quicker for 1.1sgd. Walk to Chinatown in 10 mins, took 50 minutes on shuttle. 3). Zion rd food centre is closed for reonvation. The food court at the Pearl building (next to Outram Park MRT) is very cheap, clean, and good.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, nothing fancy, adequate for a couple of nights stopover”
Reviews.Author: Sailor42London
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in the Miramar located on Havelock Road adjacent to the Singapore River, close to Robertson Quay. The hotel is roughly a 10 minute walk from the numerous restaurants, bars and other facilities at Clarke Quay including the Underground rail link. We found Clarke Quay a little too busy for our liking, but a walk in either direction along the river from the hotel will reveal numerous riverside bars and restaurants. One, called eM, opposite the hotel on the other side of the river offers free wi-fi, albeit not completely reliable. A petrol station adjacent to the hotel has a small supermarket, handy for essentials. The hotel itself is adequate, nothing fancy. The room was reasonable, sufficient drawers, cupboards and coat hangers, mini bar and tea / coffee making facilities. Bed was comfortable and the room seemed clean. The hotel offered wi fi at exhorbitant rates, it has a swimming pool and a small gym, neither of which I used but both seemed fine. My room rate didn't include breakfast so I cannot comment on the standard of the hotel restsurants, rather than pay hotel prices for breakfast, Clarke Quay has both Starbucks and Macdonalds. The bar offered live music in each evening and also has a small outside seating area. Reception and hotel lobby staff were all pleasant and efficient. Whilst I have no complaints about the Miramar, it was all a little basic and had a budget feel to it. I would prefer to spend a little more and get a higher standard of accommodation. It's okay for a couple of nights stopover.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: waqaspai
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in 2004. Perhaps a low price hotel as compared to other singapore hotels, this was average priced. No major complaints - except there was some problem in the washroom and it was immediately looked after. The hotel was near to china town- just 5 minutes walk. It was a good stopover stay of 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for stopover, not much more”
Reviews.Author: alee8118
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights as part of Singapore Airlines Stopover Holiday. We chose it primarily based on price. The room seems to have been recently renovated as the furnishings look quite new. It is reasonably sized and has supplies which you would expect in most hotels. The room is tidy except that there were ants in the bathroom. The hotel is not as centrally located as we first thought - the nearest MRT station is a good 20min walk (which can be quite tough in the heat if you are not used to it). However, taxis in Singapore are quite cheap so it is not too much of a problem and a trip around town generally costs less than S$10.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Brown_Sugar2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents and we enjoyed ourselves. The staff is very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay by the river.”
Reviews.Author: Sunny58
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night / 1 day on a stopover in Singapore in a riverview room. The Hotel is in a nice position near the river and the riverside restaurants. The room was comfortable but there are better value Hotels nearby. The room was in need of an update but clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. It was easy to get around with taxi's and bus stop outside and there is a convenience store next door in the fuel station. We had a late checkout and after that left our bags to be looked after safely in the luggage room.Qantas holidays seemed to have the best price at AU$200- I found there was a huge difference with pricing between booking sites-so shop around. I probably would not stay here again unless it was a really good price as there are nicer Hotels nearby at a lesser price. All in all a comfortable pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ness710
Reviews.Content: The location is kinda centrally located if you drive. The closest train station is about 15-20 mins walk. Room was decent, a bit small but its ok for a short stay, it was clean though. Frontdesk staff was very helpful and nice. However, we kinda had to run outside the street to grab a cab in the rain as the bell boy werent able to call one.

Reviews.Title: “On the Way Home " Stop Over "”
Reviews.Author: DABJILL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Miramar. We had emailed ahead to ask for a mid level room with a river view and got exactly what we requested. A lovely clean and spacious room overlooking the river onto Robinson Quay. The breakfast buffet was a mix of western and asian food but enough choices to satisfy most people. The only thing I found strange was that some visitors would be taken through the dividing walk way in the breakfast room to two hotel lifts situated at the other end of the building. I think this was due to specific room locations in this large hotel. All the staff are very hard working and very helpful in wanting you to enjoy your stay. The hop on-hop off red Singapore City tour bus stops right outside the hotel ( first Bus 9.35am then every half hour ) a must if you want to see all the sights Singapore has to offer. If you fancy a nice walk then follow the river past Clark Quay and Fullerton Hotel and you will end up at the Marina Bay ( about 45mins ) If you want a spectacular view of Singapore then take the lift ($20 ) up the Marina Sands Hotel in the bay better and cheaper than the Singapore Flyer. One last thing use the petrol station next door for any extra snacks or drinks you might want to purchase I enjoyed my time here and would I recommend the Miramar. YES

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ones!”
Reviews.Author: freedomfortwo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in February 2012. It was a great experience: very clean, room nice and spacious, helpful staff. Were in our room by 8am after early arrival from Amsterdam! 15 minutes to Chinatown, restaurants and cafes across the road along the river! Got guest discounts on hotel breakfasts and dinners! Very good beds: important when you get older! Very pleasant, will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Cenral Location.”
Reviews.Author: scw_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Miramar for 6nts from Feb 11th 2012.Check-in was easy and the Tripadvisor tip of asking for a River View room was excellent as it is a much better view than a Pool View.Which we were first offered.But the change was done effortlessly.Found all staff helpful and friendly and the room offered clean and tidy.Lots of places nearby to eat and drink at,easily reached by a short walk. Taxi's are also so cheap that really nowhere around Singapore town is too far to use one.We quite often had a taxi out at night but would stroll back to the Hotel.Chinatown would be a 20-25 min stroll. My minus about the hotel is the Pool Area.Allthough it is a nice enough area you never see any staff there at all.If you want any service by the pool you have to leave the pool walk down two sets of steps and use a wall mounted phone to order a Drink,Food.Which as no-one hardly uses it is not cleared away. Saying this i would still go back to the Hotel if i paid Singapore another visit,

Reviews.Title: “A decent stop over hotel”
Reviews.Author: BWFC82
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, but felt a bit 'tired' and in need of a makeover. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, and breakfast buffet was OK. The outdoor swimming pool area was pleasant, and the hotel is close to riverside walks which take you into Clark Quay, China Town etc. There are also some pleasant riverside bars and restaurants nearby, so the location is also not bad. For a couple of nights you can't go wrong. Our only complaint would be that they charge for wifi access - $s25 for 24 hrs (about £12), which is crazy when in our experience in Thailand and Australia is that most places, even small hotels, offer it free!

Reviews.Title: “Central Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: yama9262
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Miramar end of January 2012 with 2 kids. Check in was a breeze with the Filipino Receptionist. We were in the room 11:00 AM! The room on the 10th floor is very clean and all of the staffs we talked to are very helpful. Went to Sentosa, Universal, Night Safari and Singapore Zoo and some malls by taxi from the hotel. Taxi to Universal cost us S$ 19.00 one way. Not bad since there are 6 of us. By the way we learned that for a group of 5 and up, it is better to take MPV taxis since it is not allowed to squeeze in passengers in a regular taxi. There is a food street near the hotel, tell the taxi Tiong Ma lu street. Low priced restaurants abound on this street. Check out was a breeze and the Filipino bell boy is very helpful, bell boy even informed us our taxi is already waiting for us 15 minutes before schedule. Will definitely come back to Miramar.

Reviews.Title: “Clarke quay”
Reviews.Author: Artemis-Angel
Reviews.Content: Hotel ideally located for all of the restaurants and action st Clarke quay just come out of hotel cross road and follow the river to the right for ten minutes. Bus stop just outside for either normal buses or the hop on hop off bus which we used 30 dollars for two days plus a cruise on the river. If you get the chance do the cruise At night Other highlights Singapore flyer (londoneye equivalent) botanic gardens (do this early gets hot after lunch) and well worth 20 sdollars to go to top of marina bay sands hotel (just turn left off hop on hop off bus then when you come down cross the road to the shoppes and promenade on the far side of marina bay)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: diddleydi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way home from Australia. Very good location and about 15 minutes walk down to the Marina with lots to see on the way. Petrol station next door which sells all sort of things you may need or have forgotten, but the staff are very obliging and will help with all kinds of things. We never used the pool as we went out in the morning and returned at night, but it looked fine. Breakfasts were good too, plenty of choice and the staff again were very helpful. They also have a left luggage room which is good if you are flying out at night and want to make the most of your day. There are bus stops outside to various places and Clarke Quay MRT is not far away. Chinatown is a short walk around the side/back of the hotel and I did a lot of my Christmas shopping here. You can also get boats from the quayside nearby. If you want somewhere quiet but also a good city view from your window and a nice room which is clean and comfortable, then this is worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “J&J Scotland”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on route to New Zealand and 2 nights on return to Scotland. Excellent break on such a long flight. Hotel was great. All reception, restaurant, bar, porter and house keeping staff were helpful and friendly. Rooms were very good, swimming pool was a joy and the restaurant was just right, excellent service, a self service buffet, excellent meals and an enjoyable breakfast to remember. Very close to China Town, easy walking distance even for a mature couple like us. MRT at China Town, (Underground Station) is proberly the best in the world, clean. trains on time and everyone friendly and helpfull. Puts our underground systems to shame. From the MRT at China Town we were able to travel in complete comfort to Changi and to the Mustafa Centre in Little India. This place is a must to visit. Shoppers delight! Looking foward to our next visit to Singapore and the Miramar Hotel. Oh! and the Botanic Gardens are out of this world, when there, have lunch at the Halia Restaurant, you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DAWNEE40
Reviews.Content: We were booked for 2 nights but lost one night due to flight connections. However was impressed with out short stay and would stay again. All staff very pleasant and helpful. Room was clean with usual amenities in bathroom but no ironing board. Breakfast was lovely, great selection of hot and cold food. Used the shuttle bus to the shopping area and the hospitality room was handy if you have a late flight as checkout was at midday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with very spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Tony G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and found the hotel to be clean, tidy, well maintained and with good facilities. The room was very spacious and comfortable. The complaint about the aircon was dealt with promptly. The hotel is within a 15-20min walking distance of a metro station and as it is along the river its a fairly pleasant stroll, even in the rain. There is a bus stop outside the hotel that is handy. The staff were friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “staff let them down”
Reviews.Author: peter350
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were there for 4 days after a cruise The hotel was o k rooms were clean and the bus service was right outside the door However the staff at reception let them down badly We booked a double but were given a twin went back to reception but were to we would have to wait we waited over an hour before we got a room The staff gave the impression guest we were a problem and interfering with their work

Reviews.Title: “Riverfront Location ~ Chinatown a Short walk”
Reviews.Author: Newo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with from city bus "123" stop in front and across street for the city bound "123" stop. "SIA Tourist Tram" stops outside. Short walk to river for the ferry boat. Easy walk or short taxi ride to Chinatown. Easy walk along river to Clarke Quay MRT station. World Great Mall? shopping centre is easy walk of 15+mins Service station convenience store is just minutes away from the main entrance. Clean comfortable modern room ... high up in tower block is best. Very good hot and cold buffet breakfast. Menu choices for lunch and dinner. Free shared (other five local hotels) shuttle to Orchard Road and other locations. Check with concierge for details. First visit was in April 2005 for one night before midday flight. Recommend it and stayed again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with easy transportation and a great view!”
Reviews.Author: lana190
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because it easy accommodated three guests in one room. The view was very pretty, and there are more than enough restaurants near the river. The beds were very comfortable (well, the roll-away bed not so much) and the pool was small but not very populated. Air conditioner also cooled down the room considerably. The hotel was more than happy to call cabs for us and the concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased we stayed at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FellwalkersCumbria
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on a stopover with Singapore airlines. We enjoyed a very restful night in a comfortable room over looking the river, just what was needed after a long flight. We walked across the road to gain access to the riverside quay where we ate outside at Bar Bar Black Sheep, great meal and atmosphere. Breakfast at the hotel was very good, excellent service, as was tea later that afteroon. Cannot fault the staff at the Hotel, they were polite and very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Our stopover vouchers not ony gave us complimentary transport to and from Changi airport, but also paid for a river trip. We choose to alight, after the boat toured downriver and around the harbour, to enable us to walk around the old colonial part of town and partake of a gin-sling in Raffles. Of course ! Then we enjoyed a lovely walk around the Botanical gardens, which concluded our day and a half in Singapore. One tip on travelling around the city. We found the taxis good value but one event soured the experience. We took one of cycle rickshaws from outside Raffles. Unfortunately ours was a rip-off merchant, and despite checking the price before we started, the price 'went up' twice before we were dropped off only half way to the Botanical Gardens. We didn't even have enough Singapore dollars to pay the price he now demanded which had increased by some 50 dollars, so we argued the toss and paid less. Not a pleasant encounter at all. However, the Hotel Miramar experience was a very good one and we shall definitely return when we make another stopover in Singapore. We still have plenty to see and do and next time we shall use conventional taxis, although there is plenty to do and see within walking distance. The Hotel is very conveniently situated. Thanks to the staff, not only for your attention during our stay but also in relation to your prompt help and reply when I lost my camera.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful in a crisis”
Reviews.Author: Robyn55
Reviews.Content: My mother, daughter & I recently booked for 2 nights at the Miramar on our way back from India to Australia. My mother became ill on the plane, & the staff very quickly found us a room when we arrived early in the morning so my mother could rest. When she remained ill, they arranged for a doctor to contact us, who then arranged for her admission to hospital. We needed to extend our stay so that my mother could be stabilised before flying home. The staff were all very helpful & considerate in every way. The rooms are clean & the hotel is in a good position. I would recommend this hotel to all travellers. Hopefully others won't need the sort of help we did though.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal stop over”
Reviews.Author: SAXONY
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling through Singapore the Hotel Miramar is a good place to stop the rooms are a very good standard and have comfortable beds. It is situated at Clarks Quay which means you only have to cross over the bridge or road at the front of the hotel to reach the night life For those wishing to venture further Orchard Road or China Town are only a short Taxi ride away of can be reached on foot in about 20 minutes however it is very humid We used the Hotel Cafe and found the food adequate The staff are all very friendly and will go out of there way to assist you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Lynda H
Reviews.Content: Spent several days here on the way to Australia and then on the return journey. Staff were excellent -- made sure we had the same room on the return journey which we had requested. Room was large with really comfortable king size plus bed. Close to China Town, walkable - really worth a visit, also can walk along the river bank, alongside the hotel. Do take a trip to Raffles for a Singapore sling, plus afternoon tea is quite an experience !

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain - bus stop at hotel front”
Reviews.Author: saint_kevin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice this year and had no complaint for both visit. The first selling point is the bus stop right in front of the hotel. Knowing that transport system is quite well in Singapore, I had fun hopping on and off buses. The next selling point is the reasonable priced room. Overall, I would return to this hotel if I travel to Singapore on my own expense.

Reviews.Title: “No frills quality”
Reviews.Author: Pabrro
Reviews.Content: I almost chose not to give this hotel a review because I couldn't decide what i thought of it. But I think I can sum it up as: quality without a lot of frills. The room was spacious and everything worked. The decor was dated but functional. Bathroom...same thing. I guess my only complaint would be the wi-fi was very slow. The service was great and the location served me well. The breakfast is way overpriced, so I would suggest skipping and getting something on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Much better position than you expect.”
Reviews.Author: Phuqnose
Reviews.Content: This is a great position on the river at Robertson Quay. Very quiet and comfortable. An easy 10 min walk to Clarke Quay and Chinatown, both with MTR stations. Try walking as much as possible--most major spots are not as far as you think from the map. Very helpful staff and spacious quiet pool.Will return My tips; Taxis have all kind of charges,depending on time of day.Credit card taxi payment is 17% EXTRA. Just ask. Carrefour (yes!) in Plaza Singapora has good prices for wine.Don't even think of buying it in a restaurant.! Try booking through BA- no flt reqd. 3 nights for 2,we did end to end i.e. 6 for 4. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: rugbytrisha
Reviews.Content: This hotel overlooks the river the rooms are clean although they do look a bit tired and the bathrooms could do with refurbishment. The buffet breakfast was excellent lots of choice. The staff were very helpful. The location of the hotel was away from the main harbour area there was a bus stop outside the hotel, the nearest metro station was about 20 mins away.WE found the walk along the river towards the harbour good.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey9791
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Singapore stop over. Our travel agent mucked up our booking but the hotel staff were excellent and remedied the situation quickly. This was in spite of my dummy spit. Rooms were great. they were clean, spacious and tidy. The cafe staff also were excellent and very, very helpful. The even help with recommendations on what to see and do while we where here.

Reviews.Title: “Hols/11”
Reviews.Author: Gordon M
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, well situated for getting about.Staff were very helpful and the rooms were of a high standard. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff & tidy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Scamp7
Reviews.Content: We had six nights over two seperate stopover visits. Staff were friendly and extremely helpful. When we arrived at 8am after 20 hours of travel needing to sleep the conceige quickly arranged access to our room which they will do if the room is ready. fantastic and very welcome. We always recieved great help from desk staff - including advice that allowed us to get our broken laptop fixed. The porters were not only efficient but also extremely friendly. The rooms were clean and ours had a great view of the river and the pool area was lovely and a great break form the heat and pace of the city. One of main concerns was the distance from areas we wished to visit. This was no problem - the Singapore Airlines 'hop-on' bus combined with the bus service and taxis provide good value trips anywhere. In walking distance was Chinatown. we also did several walks back from town along the river. The hotel ticked all the boxes. We were surprised that they only had two non-smoking floors but as we had no problem getting on one it wasn't a problem. Thanks for a great stay to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: Philduck
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Miramar on numerous occasions. I believe it is the best bargain for its class of hotel in Singapore at the moment. I always book using the British Airways web site - bargain or what? The location is fine if you are willing to use Singapore's excellent public transport system. There is a bus stop outside the hotel and another across the road in front of the Riverview hotel. Just get an EZ card for travel convenience. Everywhere in Singapore is accessible via public transport links. Thw MRT is fast and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: barbiehen
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, very centrally located too. Just around the corner within walking distance of Great Wall City Mall, China Town, the Marina. Great Service from staff nothing was a problem for them to assist you. I would recommend the Night Time Safari excursion, and book it through the hotel rep, don't take the meal deal though unless you are sure that you will eat it. The pool area on the roof is spotless as are the rooms. If you show your flight stubs to the driver on the SIA air conditioned bus which stops outside the hotel every hour, then you get to see the city on a hop on hop off basis for Six Singapore dollars, fantastic value for money. Don't be put off by the dress code for Raffles, shorts and t'shirts are perfectly acceptable. The staff at night will bring food to the bar, where you can help yourself to satay and rice and noodls etc at no cost, which is great after a day of sightseeing. Overall we loved Singapore, however, a note of caution if you have paid for your transfers, make sure they turn up, as ours did not and we almost missed our plane to Australia. Go, enjoy, be pampered and have a ball.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in singapore cheaply”
Reviews.Author: ozzielady
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Miramar in September, after much research and pricing of hotels in singapore. We were in Singapore 10 years ago, and really noticed when we went to book for 3 nights, the prices of hotels had skyrocketed. We got a fabulous deal from a booking site for the Miramar for 3 nights, and although a little apprehensive after what we paid, we were in for a very pleasant surprise. Found this hotel to be clean, and had everything we wanted. Had asked for a higher floor, knowing it was on a busy road, and we were given a spacious corner room on the 14th floor. The air conditioning was very quiet (unlike some hotels) and extremely efficient. The room was spacious and although people have mentioned "old fashioned and dated", I would actually call it homely. I felt very comfortable there, and we had fantastic views out of our large window. We may have unknowingly been upgraded to a better room than we booked, as it was larger than expected. Bed and pillows were very comfortable, and the bathroom had plenty of shelf space which is nice to have. Probably you could say the bathroom was a little dated, but had a huge tub and shower and good accessories. We found the staff, particularly the door staff very friendly and helpful and reception booking in was fine. Booking out we struck a rather ordinary person, but have already received a letter from Miramar apologising to us, which wasn't expected. This hotel was not right in the thick of it as, say the Excelsior, but we thought it was in a great spot, right next to the river, and very close to many restaurants just across the bridge. Also walked to Clark Quay and Boat Quay, but if it's too hot, just get a taxi as they are so cheap and easy. Also the bus stops out front, and as been said, a great convenience store next door (and also one across the bridge). We heard no traffic noise at all, but loved our views. Should we return to Singapore, it would probably be for a stop-over, but I would not hesitate to stay at the Miramar again if we obtained a good price. Their on-site cafe/restaurant also looked like it had some nice food and ambience, but admit we did eat outside for the experience. A must-do is the water taxi by night - amazing to see it all lit up. All in all, I would recommend this as a safe, clean, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel, with good English speaking staff, and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Clean, Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaelkrikke
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in September 2011 & although i've stayed at much nicer hotels, hotel prices in Singapore are out of control. The hotel itself is nicely presented, clean, safe & well kept, the lobby staff are very friendly & can speak/understand good english. Room is very basic & nothing fancy, but has everything you need to make for a pleasant comfortable stay, good aircon, quiet & clean bathroom. I did not use the hotel's gym or pool as they both close at 7pm, i also did not eat at the hotel as there are plenty of other places to eat nearby for far less cost. There are train subway stations quite nearby & the outram park subway takes you to Changi Airport for only 3 dollars!! (fantastic) Also within a short walk is Clarke Quay, a great tourist spot with loads of bars, cafes, clubs & shops + another subway station. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TF3
Reviews.Content: The Miramar is a nice hotel. We had a deluxe room which was quite spacious and the location near to Clarkes Quay is great, with lots of good restaurants and bars. Only small criticism, don't know if this is standard for Singapore but the beds are like sleeping on a rock!

Reviews.Title: “a good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: S D
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed for 3 nights in 2 twin rooms . The rooms were bright & clean.The sheets & towels were changed every day. The hop on hop off tour bus stopped outside the hotel.There is a 24hour petrol station next door where you can get botteled water,snacks etc. we purchased muffins which we had for breakfast (the hotel has tea/coffee making facilities in the room) as we were on room only basis. We were 10 minutes walk from China town.All in all a good clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad overall”
Reviews.Author: CJB2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The location was a bit far out from the main centre and not that close to the train station. Apart from that it was quite a pleasant stay. The pool was very nice and made use of the jaciuzzi. No bar at the pool though. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were kept very clean although we did have someone knock on the door at about half 8 a few of the mornings going 'house keeping-house keeping' so make sure you put the 'do not disturb' on the door. Overall not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeraldA
Reviews.Content: Nice large room with all necessary facilities. Although initially given wrong room [bed arrangement incorrect] this was soon sorted out, although had to have a smoking rather than the booked non-smoking room. Odour however not too bad. Staff helpful. Restaurant used in evening for a buffet meal seemed okay. Quite a good position in Singapore, where using the taxis is fine, as they are very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Let down”
Reviews.Author: Eringarratt
Reviews.Content: Being an international hub I would of thought all hotels would have free wifi and tv that spoke in English these days. Although I'm travelling the world and have stayed in motels, hotels etc I was yet to find accomodation that didn't offer this service, until Hotel Miramar. $28 for a days use of Internet is taking the Michael. I'm ashamed to say it but these days Internet especially when travelling is almost secondary to oxygen! It'll also cost you $8 for an OJ and I found staff to choose lying over telling you they're just not sure!! I'm sure there's a lot better hotels nearby so make sure you shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: crookedannie
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean and well appointed by the river and the hop on and off bus right outside. Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay both within 10 min walk. Staff so very helpful and always cheerful. Nice pool and sunbathing area. Without hesitation would visit again . Restaurant good value.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the suite”
Reviews.Author: agentgibbs
Reviews.Content: We were given an upgrade and had adjoining two bedrooms each with their own bathroom. Master bedroom had a desk as well. The interconnecting doors could be locked from inside the room. The upgrade also included use of the hospitality rooms after checkout. The two rooms set aside for this were much more basic, and we wondered if they were standard rooms. (Towels were provided so you could havea shower if you wanted). If so they were also quite small, and it would be worth paying for the larger rooms. The hotel is near the river and there is a convenience store atthe garage next door. Buffet breakfast was OK but not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “front desk Staff is not very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: marguerite12
Reviews.Content: It wasn't love at first sight at all! Previous times we've stayed in The Intercontinental, a small, colonial style, elegant and pleasant hotel. However we had a tight budget and so we booked The Miramar for 3 nights. The Sia Hop-on bus stops right in front of the hotel and this looks very convenient. But...this location is stop nr. 10 and Orchard road is nr. 16. That will take you about 30 minutes. China town is stop nr. 7 so before you know you'll be spending 45 or 50 minutes in the bus. This doesn't necessarily have to be dull because you'll pass lots of interesting buildings. We have tried to walk from Boat Quay to the hotel but my husband was the only one who enjoyed it, too far! (45min) While in China town try to have a lovely tea-break at PS.Cafe at Ann Siang Hill Park. 45 Ann Siang Rd #02-02. Home made cakes, pies, breakfast, other breathtaking and mouthwatering meals. This location is for adults and teenagers only. Families with younger children are welcome on their other locations as on Orchard Road. For a nice view on the new Marina Sands Bay hotel: find yourself a place along Boat Quay (try Starbucks) and watch sunset. The sun will set this hotel on fire! After the first night in the Miramar we ignored the frontdesk and enjoyed our remaining days. The hotelbar serves the best Singapore Sling in town, presents good life music and offers free noodles(small plate) with your drinks. The beds are okay, not too soft, not too firm. The cashier is very friendly even when you don't have to pay the bill there's always a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Cetainly not 4*”
Reviews.Author: carolinebee
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful and friendly upon checking in, but got to our room, and was very disappointed. The bed was unbelievably hard, so went down to ask about changing rooms, to be offered a matress topper. This was like putting a cotton wool pad onto a slab of concrete and made no difference!! The room and communal areas all smelt stale, and although clean, the decor very dated and tired looking. The bathroom had cracked tiles and was nothing special. Upon our return home, I was staggered to find this hotel is listed as 4*, and felt it was at most a soft 3*.

Reviews.Title: “Handy stop over hotel - would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: vailskiier22
Reviews.Content: Room clean, reasonable size, high ceilings. Everything was provided and worked. Air con not too loud. Twin beds may be a bit short for some (probably 6 foot long) maybe they just looked small but comfortable for me. Was on 10th floor traffic noise not really an issue, although overlooking the road, not an unpleasant view towards the river. The road does start getting busy around 5 am - but the air-con covers it up. Staff helpful - no complaints at all. Internet $12 for 3 hours - I did not try it. *For Starbucks fans. Walk to Starbucks (opens 7:30 am - 1st floor of nearby Great World City shopping precinct) it will look closed from the ground floor. I walked back via the river which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year”
Reviews.Author: famwood
Reviews.Content: We spent an enjoyable few nights at the Miramar to celebrate the New Year.It was not our first stay and wont be our last.This hotel falls into the 'oldie but a goodie' category.We had a large renovated room with a nice large bathroom.Both were clean and the bathroom came with plenty of goodies including razor,shave foam,toothbrush & toothpaste.Had arranged check in for early a.m due to flights and everything went smoothly so we were able to get a decent sleep before an excellent late buffet breakfast and hit the ground running.The hotel had a great N.Y.E dinner for guests,complete with band,balloons silly hats etc. which we enjoyed before we went to watch the fireworks at midnight. This is great location to enjoy the Singapore fireworks display for N.Y.Eve.We walked along the riverfront to Marina Bay, about 30 mins,but so much to see along te way.Get there early to stake a spot,take snacks and drinks and enjoy the atmosphere.You can also walk to Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfy hotel, quiet and close to most attractions.”
Reviews.Author: debbiegordon
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here, comfy beds, good room service and friendly staff. Enjoyed the three piece phillipino band in the bar downstairs, and had a few laughs with the bar staff. Check in was a bit long winded.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: MickyPaperBoy
Reviews.Content: The Miramar is in a good location, it’s within easy walking distance for Clarke Quay (for the Bum Boats) and for Chinatown (For eating). There is a bus stop right outside the hotel; you can get the “FunV” (Hop-on Hop-off) tour bus. On this bus you will get to see all the relevant landmarks (Singapore flyer, Botanic gardens, Raffles Hotel and Orchard Road (the shopping area). The Hotel staff were very pleasant courteous. We felt very safe walking to and from the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “A really lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leila12
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our 4 day stay at the Mirama Hotel, we could NOT fault it in anyway. It was cheaper to eat at the hotel, the price for four breakfasts and four evening meals cost us only £150.00 for the two of us total. They cater for the Western palate as well as continental. We found it cheaper to have the A la carte menu at the Fern Tree Cafe. The International buffet was more pricey, but worth it if you like continental cuisine. Spotless, clean bath towels EVERY day and bed linen. Slippers in a sealed packs in wardrobe for your use, as well as fresh cotton dressing gowns. (saves the weight in your suitcase). We highly recommend this Hotel and would definitely stay there again if/when we stop over in Singapore again. The Peach Chinese Restaurant on level 5 was really nice, but expensive, a set meal of 6 courses for two was £90 which includes one bottle of wine (£30)

Reviews.Title: “Really good base to explore”
Reviews.Author: LockyNorwich
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. My friend had said it was quite a walk to anywhere but we didn't find this. We mainly ate in Robertson Quay - I think it was Ba Ba Black Sheep - a combination restaurant that did really good Thai, western or Indian food - it was packed every night so you either had to have patience to get a table or get there early. We used the Singapore Airlines hop on/off bus which took us to the Singapore Flyer - compared with the London Eye it was much better - we had a cabin to ourselves, not queuing or anything! We then walked back to the hotel from there stopping at sights as we went. My husband could not get over how little traffic there was anywhere and how cheap the transport was when everything else was expensive. We used the bus to go to the botanical gardens as well - bit of an after thought but well worth the visit. Chinatown is really close to the hotel - my husband nearly bought a camera there but luckily waited till we got to Kuala Lumpur where it was £100 cheaper! You have to do Raffles Long bar - luckily we chose that just as the heavens opened so stayed there for a while with Singapore Slings. We stayed on a high floor which gave us a bit of a view. the beds were really comfortable and the room was clean. We went to the pool once, but just as it rained again so gave up. I would definitely be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful hotel I've visited”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Lotty
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 1015, having been delayed at the airport due to smashed luggage. We needed to be able to empty the bag as it was to be picked up at 10am to be fixed. The very helpful check-in and concierge did everything possible, they sorted out the bag repair as we missed our appointment, they let us check in and could not have been more helpful. Rooms were interconnecting, as requested, which was excellent, very clean and spacious. Clean towels were available in the changing block by the spa and swimming pool, which was clean and warm. Location was very good, with easy access, via low cost taxi's. A very pleasant evening stroll can be had along the river, which is wonderful, clean and very safe. The only downside was that breakfast was not included and room service was expensive, as we had to leave at 6am for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - no more than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Charlottec81
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights in Singapore at Hotel Miramar as part of a holiday package. The hotel was clean and tidy - very polite and hard working cleaning staff. We went for a swim every morning and our room was usually serviced while we were at the pool. We were on the 15th floor and had a great view over the river. The bed was hard - if you like a softer mattress you're in trouble. The staff in general were very polite, but concierge were only interested in booking us on tours. Besides the tours, they weren't very knowledgable, for example I asked if there were any tours to Bintan Island and all they said was "No" - no suggestions on how we could get there or alternative options. It was a local taxi driver that showed us the real Singapore (look out for Roger who drives a peach coloured toyota hybrid taxi). One man at concierge was very friendly and helpful when we booked our zoo tour, but the others were quite rude and we wouldn't have booked a tour with them on principle. The facilities at the hotel are ok. The pool is quite small and always busy during the day (a couple of times they ran out of towels). The hotel has 3 restaurants and a bar, but we didn't go to any of them because of the ridiculously expensive prices. The gym is good, but again it's quite small with limited equipment. We were dissapointed with the price to use the internet - $10 per hour is really expensive considering wireless is available for free elsewhere in the city. The location of the hotel is ok. Across the river are a number restaurants and bars with a range of cuisine. The hotel isn't close to any key attractions though, or a MRT station. However, a free shuttle takes you to Orchard Road and Chinatown, there's a bus stop directly in front of the hotel and I noticed the Singapore Stopover hop-on hop-off bus stop outside. Taxis are cheap so we used them mostly and walked where possible. It cost us $18 each way to the airport in a cab, which I thought was really cheap. Overall, the hotel was ok. I wouldn't have been impressed with anything less. Based on the number of options available in Singapore and what we experienced at Mirarmar, I would probably try a different hotel next time that is closer to an MRT station and other attractions and has a bigger pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Bathrobes and slippers, a nice little touch!”
Reviews.Author: Enigma_IoM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights en route to Australia. Pleasant twin room overlooking the river, good sized bathroom. Nice touch in wardrobe, bathrobes and slippers for our use. Staff friendly in bar. They had live music on whilst we were there, though it was quite noisy with locals coming in for drinks talking very loudly. Only tried the buffet lunch once, everything was lukewarm. Though plenty of places to eat across the river. Singapore very clean, though Chinatown area quite grub and untidy. Botanical gardens are worth a visit, need several hours to do it justice, The cafe in there has plenty on the menu and very reasonable in price. Night safari enjoyable. Internet available at a cost, but drawback was paying for 3 hours and it had to be used all at once, after logging on. Taxis cheap. Tour buses worth using as you can get on and off. Reasonable too as we were given a ticket for two days but only paid for one. Tour Bus stop right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Singapore River”
Reviews.Author: Geoham69
Reviews.Content: A very nice clean hotel with extremely pleasant staff. The room was very comfortable and a good nights sleep in the large bed. The hotel is close to the river and within easy walking distance of all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location for all the city.”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for all the city sites. I would recommend the hop on, hop of bus service which stops out side the hotel for initial views of the city. Most places are walable but can take time. The quickest routes for walikng are along the river which is accessed across the road from the Miramar and behind the hotels. Raffles Hotel is a must for afternoon tea and the organised trips are really good value and work out far cheaper. China town is about 15 minutes walk away and two can eat for £2.50 (thats both not each!!!) Orchard Raod ( main shopping area) is a must and can be got to by bus/taxi or as we did walking. The hotel staff (as everyone in Sinapore) are friendly and very helpul. This is truley a wonderful city where you can wonder at anytime of the day or night and feel safe. It is clean, buzzing and a must for culture,food and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: L13m
Reviews.Content: I travelled on December 2010 during christmas, and spent almost a week in Miramar and couple of days spent in Marina Sands Hotel. Miramar is in quiet location near Clarke Quay, we just need to cross the road and stroll side of the river to enjoy Clarke Quay. It is good to do before dusk. The location of the hotel is really not for orchard lover who likes to enjoy crowds and shopping. You can find many eateries a long the riverside but they are not food court style eateries, and their price is not food court price either. Most of the eateries are great place to hang out to enjoy open air in the evening. For transportation, right in front of hotel we can find bus stop, but I mostly used taxi because we are four people so there won't be so much differrent in the cost except during peak hour (I still couldn't understand the calculation of taxi rating in Singapore when it comes to additional cost due to ERP system although I have been there many times. LOL). The facility in the hotel is very basic. The pool is small. Restaurant is good although isn't great. Good thing about this hotel is they provide temporary storing facility for our luggages although we check out already, of course it is only for short period with maximum till the next day. This kind of facility is quite helpful especially when our flight is on very late hour so we still can spend last hours going around freely without many luggages bothering us. I enjoyed same facility in Royal Park Hongkong which was really helpful when I visited Shenzhen for two days. I could travel light without many bags. Over all I can say it was worth the cost you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: swampduckgy
Reviews.Content: This was a cheap stopover option on our way to Australia. The location was close by to Clarke Quay, and we found all the nearby bars and places to eat pretty pricey; so it was as cheap to eat and drink in the hotel if you didn't fancy going far. Orchard Road is the cheaper option to eat and drink, so you may wish to stay closer to there if that's a big part of your trip. We were initially given a twin room upon arrival, that smelt pretty fusty. However, when we asked to be moved this was done immediately and the king sized bed room was fresh, clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly, in particular the bar staff and the general view was that the Singapore Slings were much nicer (and more reasonably priced) than at raffles. They had a free shuttle to Orchard Road in the day, so shopping was easy enough, although it must be said that taxis in Singapore are really cheap and easily available, so getting round isn't a problem. All in all it's a reasonable hotel, perfectly adequate for a stopover - and yes you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Alastair Craig
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to the Miramar and it functions as efficiently as ever. Excellent hotel for a stop over as it is so well organised.It has on the 4th floor an excellent outdoor pool, which is a great attraction for myself and my wife. It is situated adjacent to Clarks Quay where many restaurants and bars are set. The food is good and i can recommend it. If travelling by Singapore Airlines and using the hotel as a stopover one gets on food a 50% reduction. In these times with a falling pound, not to be sneezed at.. The staff are friendly and efficient and the beds are comfortable Alastair Craig Folkestone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good in terms of location, standard and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Bangkok
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location near the river and about 10mins walk from Clarke Quay. The rooms are a good size, nicely furnished, well maintained and spotlessly clean. The staff were extremely helpful - we were given a river view room and a late check out until 2pm for no extra charge. The pool area is extremely nice, surrounded by trees and with a jacuzzi - my only complaint (and it's a small one) would be a lack of sunbeds. In terms of value for money this is an excellent choice as it considerably cheaper than other hotels of a similar standard nearby. I would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly centrally located....”
Reviews.Author: babe33
Reviews.Content: We stayed up on the 14th floor, with a view over the river and front entrance. There are no shops nearby but a petrol station just up the road for all small things/items you might want....including fresh milk and biscuits....the hotel supplies tea/coffee and powdered milk,... so fresh milk is welcome...The hotel has a laundry system but you have no iron, it is costly and they tend to describe the clothes as the more expensive item then what you put down...it cost us $78 for 5 items....3 pairs of trousers..one gents long..... two ladies 3/4 trousers and one of each tee/polo shirts....Interent access is $12 for 3 hours continuous.....so a bit on the pricey side...The staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel did accommodate us for extra hours due to early arrival and late departure....but still at a price....There is a large swimming pool up on the 4th floor, which is very clean and fresh looking.....the dining area around reception is a little cramped and new people who have just checked in have to walk past you to get to the lifts with luggage....

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service from staff”
Reviews.Author: GeraldWiley2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the rooms are fairly spacious. While the location isn't ideal it does give good access to plenty of restaurants. The lack of free wi-fi in the lobby means you are stung for $28 per day! No free papers were provided either. Staff were very unhelpful to the point of being rude, particularly when personal items went missing from our room. Not very happy with the value for money and certainly would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: RCBSydney
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Miramar for one week in early January 2011. Upon checking in, we were pleased to have been given a room on the top floor, with exceptional views. However, just prior to being handed the room key, one of the employees suddenly switched our room and gave it to another guest. We were then given a room on a lower level with no views. Whilst we can't be certain, we strongly suspect that our original top floor room was given to a "Local". Needless to say, we were extremely disappointed about the sudden change of rooms and we also couldn't help but feel that we were discriminated against. Our room was a major disappointment, as it had an unpleasant mouldy/musty smell and was quite small (unlike the photos portrayed on the website). On our second day, we left a number of long cotton threads and large clumps of cotton lint (from newly purchased clothes) on the carpet next to the bed. Remarkably, housekeeping never bothered to vacuum this mess and it stayed on the carpet for the remaining six days of our stay. We also found the staff to be very unwelcoming and most of them ignored us completely, we truly felt uncomfortable and out of place. We even needed to hail our own taxis! We’ve travelled extensively over the past 22 years, visiting over 14 countries for both business and pleasure. However, we have never had such a poor experience as we did with the Hotel Miramar.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: zyle
Reviews.Content: $28 a night for wifi?!? ouch! no newspapers available to guests? ?? in a business town? the front desk wont help you print out a boarding pass? go use the business center for $10, they say. outside your door is a noisy 12-lane highway. chinatown and the MRT (tube/subway) are a long walk away. the rooms are bland but functional. the hotel is somewhat chilly .. bring a sweater. pool is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: JeffandFaithR
Reviews.Content: 2-night stay en route downunder. Couldn't have picked a better hotel for location, room quality and service. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: galeforce88
Reviews.Content: The second time we have stayed here, as before everything was spot on.Handy for the river walk, robertson and clarke quays and also china town. Entertainment not much to listen to but good to look at. Book your breakfast in advance its a lot cheaper. Warning____ Beware of the one eyed taxi driver who parks his green taxi by the bus stop waiting for unsuspectings fares_he will take you to any factory, shop or anywhere else who will pay him commission,we wanted to go to santora but had to go via a jewel factory which completely spoiled or day.we found comfort and kaiken the best cars.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, comfortable hotel. convenient location”
Reviews.Author: StrayCat5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights when visiting Singapore. Room - comfortable, with easy seating. Bathroom - clean & well stocked/appointed. Checkin/out - pleasent knowledgable staff. Likewise, consierge, A short (10 minute??) walk on the (almost) flat to Chinatown MRT , night market & restaurants. Extensive breakfasts - good selection of foods - restocked as needed. Bar - comfortable, but low level lighting, so not good for reading (if required). Also, prices high. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: d_nathan_99
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Miramar as a stop over to Australia. The lobby area is spacious and clean with the dining outlets either side. The check-in staff were really friendly and made sure my room was ready on arrival. The rooms are comfortably decorated and offered everything you need. The bathrooms are spacious with shower in bath and a full range of amenities (if your going to Singapore as a city break, don't pack toiletries as the hotel offer everything free). In the bedroom you have a safe, tea and coffee making facilites, minibar and bottles of water. The TV has a good range of channels and english movies are played in the evening. I had a great night sleep and there was no road noise. If you'd prefer to grab some snacks, drinks and easy meals the garage next door offers everything (very cheap). I did lot's of exploring when i was in Singapore and the hotel has a bus stop outside and a 10 minute walk will take you to the MRT. I used the taxis as they are really cheap and metered. Example... Round trip to Sentosa island $15 SGD or £7.50. I'd always go to this hotel now when i stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “The Singapore Sling -- just the one please!”
Reviews.Author: Wouldyouadamandeveit
Reviews.Content: This is a good clean modern hotel situated in a nice district, overlooking the Singapore river & within walking distance of the harbour. The bedrooms are a good size with a shower, tea/coffee facilities a "free safe" (how unusual is that), with his & hers slippers & dressing gowns hanging up in the wardrobe. A fair selection of tv programmes in English are available together with a fridge to keep all those essentials nice & cool. My wife & I asked for a room at the front overlooking the river & it was not a problem at all. We found the humidity in Singapore a big problem so it was nice to be able to control the air conditioning from the bedroom. There is a small swimming pool at the back of the hotel with a hot tub. We found the staff to be very good & friendly & they actually carried our cases when showing us to our room on the 14th floor & showed us how everthing worked (how rare is that these days). This hotel is aprox 25 mins drive from the airport. The food in the hotel is good if a little pricey, we had breakfast every morning at a cost of aprox £12.50 or 25.90 Singapore dollars each. There was a cheaper continental version but the full buffet was excellent & filling-- well recommended. So all in all a nice hotel for a long stay or a stop over for a few days in order to get over that long flight. Since our arrival back in the UK we have received a lovely letter from the Miramar management thanking us for staying there & looking forward to seeing us again (hey, how unusual is THAT).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff and great pool area a bonus”
Reviews.Author: SouthernMen
Reviews.Content: Very good room service and staff were eager to assist. Room was quiet ( 10th floor) but a little dated and smelt musty, but adequate. Made good use od a spacious outdoor pool area. Handy to river walk which leads to cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not damp or odorous as some reviews suggested”
Reviews.Author: mjthorntree
Reviews.Content: A largely young staff was polite, helpful and efficient. The bellboy who showed me to my room was especially friendly and welcoming. Located at a large urban road junction there is an 8 lane main road at the front. But there is a pedesrian footbridge (steps only) immediately in front of the hotel, and also street level pedestrian controlled traffic lights. My room was at the rear and quiet. It overlooked a terrace with a pool and beyond that high rise apartments. There was no feeling that you were being overlooked. The room was clean and pleasant, non smoking (as most of the hotel seems to be) and it did not have the atmosphere of dampness that some contributors reported. Next to the hotel there isa petrol station with a shop attached, useful for the water and soft drinks and snacks you will want. Opposite the hotel there are well maintained footpaths along the river banks of the Singapore River extending for several kms to the financial centres and the old trading quays (with interesting bronze groups of 19th century traders) Lower down the river there are restaurants, barsand shopping centres as part of the redevelopment of the total waterfront. Where the footpaths come to roads there are underpasses under the road bridges (after heavy rain some can develop deep temporary flood pools if the drains cannot cope). I walked the river bank in daytime and after dark and as a retired person never felt threatened walking on my own. I concluded that the hotel is in a very safe area. Buses stop immediately in front of the hotel and taxis are always driving through the front driveway of the hotel on the off chance they might be wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: irapr
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Mirimar. The first one about 3 years ago. Both times I was in Singapore for a family wedding. Mirimar is a lovely hotel close to Chinatown (we walked there a couple of times - approx 10min). My room was clean and comfortable - and I am pretty picky. It was just as nice three years ago. It is reasonably priced and has some great deals. The staff are friendly and helpful. It has a free shuttle bus to Orchard Road but taxis are not that expensive if you are travelling with others. I loved the shopping in Chinatown more so than Orchard Road so found the location ideal. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel tired, but staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBrown
Reviews.Content: We stopped here, using the singapore airline stopover and can't rate the staff highly enough. The building is tired, the bathroom needs re-grouting, but the rooms were clean, the beds good and the staff were excellent We ate supper & breakfast there, was good food (not amazing, but good) and the staff could not have been more helpful. Without asking they changed our rooms to a connecting one as we have 3 kids & normally have to split the kids with a parent. The pool was great and just generally they worked hard to make sure we had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel with Very Hard Beds”
Reviews.Author: harlan8
Reviews.Content: I was here one night with tour group, after which I moved to Merchant Court, due to the more central location. This is a very nice 4 star place, very clean, good size rooms, etc. The only thing was that the beds were really hard. I thought maybe the box spring and mattress had been switched, but no. Also no affordable wifi, which seems to be the bad norm in Singapore. You can walk to Chinatown and Clark Quay, but it is a bit of a walk. I saw many people eating in the restaurant, looked good, although I went to Hawker Centers, which I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good place and value”
Reviews.Author: RolandStamf
Reviews.Content: First of all was the location I like. There are many things to do around the hotel. I stayed in the hotel for 3 days. I comment the hotel in just some short word: Nice hotel, helpful and friendly staff, room clean and spacious, location convenient, good value. Stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: sialianddan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on our way to Bali and 1 night on the way back. We had no complaints about the hotel - the rooms were comfortable and clean, the pool was nice and the location was great. Although it's not next to an MRT station there are 3 within walking distance and you're just across the road from Robertson Quay / Clarke Quay which have tons of differernt restaurants. You're also close to Chinatown and LIttle India, which offer great dining opportunities. We were room only and the breakfast in the hotel was quire expensive - we ate across the road instead. All in all a pleasant hotel - I wouldn't want to spend my 2 week holiday there but it's great fgor a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinodn76
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 days during my trip to Singapore for Business as well as leisure in July 10. The Cleanliness and the Service in the hotel is good. It is located at a good location, closer to all the important locations in the city viz, Clarke Quay, China Town, Singapore Flyer, Merlion Park etc... Most of the tour agencies have a clear pick-up and drop facility to and from this hotel. It has a good restaurant with lavish spread of Breakfast menu and good food. Cosy beds and good facilities. All in All, Worth Staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Cruzey
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on the river and short walk to Orchard Road. Nice swimming pool (did not use the gym but it looks good)! Clean, comfortable room with excellent service (really appreciated the crisp sheets changed daily - so lovely!). This was a return visit and I would definitely stay there again! My only grouch was the cost of internet access!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TubesPendle
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel clean, good breakast, helpful staff. Only 10 mins walk to china town & from here you can catch the underground to all the places of interest, the underground is cheap & easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Hotel Miramar and its value for money”
Reviews.Author: springqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Miramar for four nights, from July 1 to July 5. Arriving latish on the 1st it was nice to see our room had been prepareda and we had gotten a river view and a king size bed just as i asked in my email to the hotel. Despite what some reviewers say, there is a whole nest of restaurants over the road in Roberston Quay. I got lost going there the first night, but from our room could see the steps down from the road. We had dinner at a very busy restuarant, and the food was very good. only sting was that they charge per 100g of seafood and my husband asking for a small serving of snapper was stung $63 Singapore dollars for his 700g fish. we also had breakfast at a close by restaurant on our last morning with more success. our room was lovely and the curtains hid all light until you pulled them in the morning. we used the robes and i wore mine to the pool which is lovely and in a garden setting. The breakfast at the hotel is too expensive in my opinion esp considering they dont really cater for you having anything other than the buffet, because they overcharge for every other component of breakfast. So we used the convenience store next door and bought curry puffs on two mornings. only cost a couple of dollars and saw us happy until we reached a food court or something. Having the bus stop right outside the door and also having the night safari bus stop at our hotel is a real bonus. we used the Singapore airlines HOHO bus for two days, who could go past it for a total of $12 for 2 days and if on an official SA stopover visit it is free. We took two stops and went to the gardens where we had breakfast once and then explored the gardens inc the Orchid Garden. how spectacular. I loved the room adn teh staff esp the tour guide adn the bell hops were wonderful. the information staff did lack a bit of information, but perhaps it is hard to know everything tourists ask. the Research I did on TA before our trip came in very handy. My husband was agog at how well i had resarched and prepared what we were doing and where. Will return again and prob stay at the miramar. save the extra money to spend on clothes and eating and going out .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahandChris
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of our honeymoon, cant fault the hotel. It was my birthday whilst we were there, Hotel gave us a yummy chocolate cake and fruit platter. Rooms are good sized and very clean with robes and slippers. Hotel had pool which was great and got good sun. In walkin distance (10 mins) to Clarke Quay and the bus stops right outside for city tour. Would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- could be better”
Reviews.Author: claireharbor
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was the cheapest that had good reviews. Was pleased with the room (it was HUGE) think we must have been upgraded. The hotel was clean and to a high standard. There was a nice pool area and resturant on site, as usual with most hotels breakfast wasn't included and was very overpriced. The hotel was across the road from the Singapore River but a good 10 mins walk to the bars and resturants and 20 mins walk from China town (and in the singapore heat that seemed even longer) However there is a public bus stop right outside the hotel - where the sightseeing bus also stopped which was great. Was dispointed with the service the staff seemed unfriendly and unhelpful. Maybe it was because we'd just arrived from China where the service was excellent. In the end we gave up asking and used the hotel internet (at £5 for half an hour!!) to find out about the local area because the staff didn't know. I would stay here again but only if it was at as good price.

Reviews.Title: “ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireDarren
Reviews.Content: We chose the Miramar as it seemed to be an ideal location for exploring singapore. Located close th the Singapore river with ease of walking to the main harbour area, shops, bars and restaurants. If you book any of the trips and tours this hotel is ldeally placed and is one of the first pick up and drop of points. The hotel staff are very helpful and the facilities are sufficient. meals in the hotel are plentyful and breakfast at $22 singapore dollars is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: rohitd29
Reviews.Content: A good property. It is well equipped with all the basic amenties. It has a roof top swimming pool, a gym, a bar on the ground floor and a coffee shop. Hotel has a very quiet environment which is outstanding. Location is also good

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: AnnieM1
Reviews.Content: We should have stayed for 3 nights but ended up staying for 10 due to the flight disruption in Europe, so we really got to know this hotel and city well! The hotel staff were always helpful and understanding in extending our stay on a daily basis and ensured we kept our room (704) for the duration of our stay. Only had breakfast once in the hotel - food was fine, just a little expensive. The location is great and although well served by transport links we walked almost everywhere and in every conceivable direction – Botanical Gardens, Orchard Road (found a short-cut - across river and through park), Singapore Flyer, Bugis, Raffles, Little India and Chinatown (both fascinating). Use the riverside pathway to nearby Clarke Quay or closer still to Robertson Walk where we found reasonably priced drinks and good food at ‘Wine Connection’, which is situated at the other end of the arcade on Unity Street. There aren’t many ATMs in the area and after regularly walking to the one the hotel told us about in Chinatown, we eventually spotted one on the opposite side of the river to Clarke Quay. Should we ever feel the need to visit Singapore again, we would definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: swhiteEssex
Reviews.Content: Overlooking the river just a short stroll from clarke quay and china town Great value for money ideal base for shopping and sightseeing Rooms clean and spacious Perfect for short city break, has everything you need would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: addikted2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights,Hotel was ok,Room smelt musty,room was a little old but ok for our first time stay. Breakfast was good,Bacon especially nice. Close to all shopping areas,and you can walk to most places,China Town. Would probably stay somewhere else next time we come to Singapore,but this hotel is good for first timers. Clean and close to all amentities.

Reviews.Title: “Good value place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ImmigrantTyke
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and very well positioned in Singapore alongside the river. Fantastic staff and a truly wonderful Chinese buffet. Breakfast is a bit expensive but there is a great little cafe over the river about 100 yards away.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tan21Perth
Reviews.Content: a clean hotel all the staff are very polite the breakfast had a nice range of food and our dishes were always cleaned up straight away.our family stayed for 8 days and really enjoyed the hotel it was very quiet and most days we had the pool to ourselves always plenty of towels at the poolside the only downside was the beds are very small and the pillows are soft our sheets were changed everyday the rooms do have a slight odour to them but its the humidity the hotel is about 10-15 min walk to clarke quay over the river is a great cafe called kith loved the food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Clake Quay but slightly run down rooms”
Reviews.Author: macracs
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a 3 night stopover. We upgraded to a spacious club room which i thought was a bit run down, the room stunk of smoke, the bed was hard and the bath was a bit shabby. The breafast was good and the staff helpful. There was a free shuttle bus to several areas throughout the town droppng off throughout the day which i though was good. The hotel was well located for Boat and Clarke Quay. This is a standard 3 star hotel, just somewhere you lay you head and enjoy the sights of singapore. Would i stop here again? Prob not would i recommend it? Prob not

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alveleydon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very friendly and comfortable.The meals are very good with a large choice.It is a little away from the centre

Reviews.Title: “hotel by the river”
Reviews.Author: ramsfanDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: The reception staff let us have a room at 7am after our flight from Manchester. The room was clean and spacious, but had a distinct stale cigarette smell, although we had requested a non-smoking room. The international buffet in the restaurant was excellent.
