It was a longish stroll to the nearest MRT station, but a pleasant walk either way along thr river. A hospitality room was provided for late departures. A short stay here would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “OK City hotel, with average cafe/restaurant”
Reviews.Author: psteph08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on stopover in both directions from NZ. Room was fine with good aircon. Breakfast buffet was very average . Once we found our way around, the location was good for restaurants at Clarke Quay. Staff were helpful and trips arranged mostly very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chadnetman62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Miramar on stop over on way to Sydney, the hotel is situated in a nice area of Singapore close to the river - 5 minute walk - which as all the restaurants and bars you need, outside the hotel is the local "hop on, hop off" bus service which is a must to see Singapore. Staff very good, rooms although small are well maintained and clean, good small hotel with excellent chinese buffet .

Reviews.Title: “fabulous singapore”
Reviews.Author: DRAWHO
Reviews.Content: my wife and i spent 8 lovely nights at this wonderful hotel celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. if you want posh (5 star) this is not for you, if you want a clean hotel with very freindly staff and good food in a good location then you won't be disappointed with the miramar. our room was cleaned, sheets changed and toiletries topped up every day. we were always greeted with a freindly hello or goodbye whenever we came into or left the hotel. a wide choice of food was on offer in the restaurant from various countries both at breakfast (buffet) and evening meal (buffet or al acarte). hotel is 10 to 15 mins walk to nearest mrt ( which is very easy to use) 10 mins walk to china town and clarke quay. singapore is a very safe place to be even for a lady travelling on her own. all cultures mix well and everyone is very civil to each other. a couple even went out of their way one evening on their way home from work to show us a place we wanted to go and eat. you cannot go wrong with any place you decide to have a meal. we ate at restaurants, hawkers stalls and markets and in the hotel and all served great food. alcohol is a little expensive but not excessively. all in all you cannot fail to enjoy this fabulous city with its wonderful people, food and attractions oh yes there is plenty to see. go on give yourselves a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good food, service and near centre”
Reviews.Author: 4barley
Reviews.Content: Stopover 2 nights on way to New Zealand. Close to Singapore river and within easy walking distance of Clarke and Robertson Quays with their wide range of restaurants. Service good and enjoyed an evening meal and 2 breakfasts in the restaurant. Bus sevice almost directly opposite takes you to the excellent botanical gardens. Close to Chinatown which we found fascinating.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location, food and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bully1959Canaries
Reviews.Content: The rooms were tired. Food was poor and location is away from the centre of town. Good restaurants nearby and bus stop outside hotel only redeeming features.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, fantastic staff, good location. Breakfast great”
Reviews.Author: tiflco
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and was really glad we chose this. The room was clean, the hotel clean, restaurant served a great breakfast and dinner. The room we had was a twin and was spacious, we had a view at the back of the hotel. The hotel location is a short walk (15 minutes) to Clarke Quay along the river, and the there is a bus stop just outside the hotel, which we had a hippo pass (sightseeing bus) which served us like a taxi. The staff in the hotel was great. I really enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again everytime we stay in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: naebrm
Reviews.Content: stayed at Miramar 3nights in december hotel is excellant wonderful breakfast room & view is really good ,free bus to orchard road or taxis are very cheap all in all very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not too far out, easy access to all locations.”
Reviews.Author: HollyJane
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights on our way back from Australia. It was on a B & B basis, and we got a good deal, as breakfast was excellent. A good choice of fruit, cereals, a variety of eggs, and all sorts of goodies! It was about 10-15 mins walk to Clarke Keys MRT. This meant we could get to places quite easily. The hotel room was clean, tidy and quiet. The hotel itself was busy, but that didnt cause any issues. We were hardly in the hotel with going out early and returning later in the evenings. Good value for money and a good breakfast, would go back again. JANE

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyBromsgrove_
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, on the 14th floor, on our way to Australia, as you do. Checked in at 9am and were given our room keys straight away. The room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. Couldn't hear a thing either from inside our outside the hotel. Breakfast was brilliant with a very wide choice. Eggs cooked to order. Staff very friendly and helpful; always smiling. Nothing was too much trouble even altering a pre-booked trip at the last moment. An easy walk to Clarke Quay and Boat Quay and just about next-door to bustling Chinatown. Late check out room available, but not advertised. Will definitely stay there again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good hotel...economic if booked through SIA”
Reviews.Author: IndiaHunter
Reviews.Content: We took the Singapore Stop Over and stayed at Miramar for 3 days. It was a great deal for us, because apart from all the goodies from Singapore Airlines, the hotel was also very good - a value for money in the package we took. Its located just in front of the bus stop - which connects us to Clarke Quay and Orchard. Besides, the access to MRT is nit far- you can either walk to nearest MRt or take a taxi ( around 5 SGD in off peak hours). The hotel is nice, clean and decent, with many options for food- although we generally ate outside because of the hectic touring in the city. The staff is good, and very friendly to support on every possible issue, even changing the room if you dont like it ( we did it, because was wanted a double bed room and not a twin bed room). Overall- go for it if you are not looking for much. We never used the Gym/swimming pool etc, so not too sure about it. But for a short stay in Singapore, its a perfect choice !

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: RobertSterling
Reviews.Content: The service is very good Very nice breakfast!!! Not so far from the center by walking.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: shopholics
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 8 nights and found the hotel and its staff to be great. Room was clean, couldn't hear people in other rooms, nothing was too much trouble. The Bell Captain - Roger - was very helpful with tips on tours or just general informationas were the other guys. Plenty of options for breakfast choices, food all nice.20min walk to chinatown and 10 min walk to claarke quay. well postiioned hotel. recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel for relaxation and Service”
Reviews.Author: Rynette
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Miramar on holiday twice now in 2008,and 2009, and intend to stay again next year.Stayed at another Singapore hotel on stopovers to UK before and felt out of place.Miramar Hotel made us welcome from the moment our taxi arrived at the entrance and cotinued thoughout our stay.The staff were so helpfull .The rooms were clean and tidy with a great outlook of the pool.Both times we were there for 10 glorious days.I would not stay any where else now that we have The Miramar.Good on you for a great place

Reviews.Title: “Love an early check in”
Reviews.Author: hateswork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a total of 4 nights on a stopover to and from europe. This hotel provided everything you need. We were particularly pleased with an early check in after arriving at at the hotel at 8 am after an overnight flight. The hotel is a little far from the nearest train station, though this didn't bother us too much as we don't mind walking. There is a shuttle bus though we never made use of it. The pool is not as nice as the photos though great to cool down after a day of sightseeing. Breakfast was great and had everything you need. The is a convenience store in the petrol station next door which was much cheaper than hotel's minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: spiderpigScotland
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 days in the Miramar Hotel in Singapore. We found it to be very good, with the staff extremely friendly and couteous, able to sort out any quesries. We expecially enjoyed the breakfast as it was extremely varied, from British fry up to Jaanese breakfast and trying all the different foods was an enjoyable part of the Holiday. I was a little disappointed in the gym as it is very small and has no water cooler within it. Saying that it had all the machines I required but would be full with 3 people in it. When we were there the pool was being refurbished but we had access to the Hotels next door which we made use off. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Singapore and would stay at the Miramar again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a 3*”
Reviews.Author: HolBunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the 1st 3 nights of our honeymoon before moving on to Bali. Location - We found the position good. Well, what we didn't realise is that in Singapore, everything is close anyway. It was only a 5 minute walk to Chinatown, which we ventured to our 1st evening. We'd walked it from the hotel up to Orchard Road, and 1 pleasant evening we walked along the river (which is just over the main road from the Miramar) to Clarke Quay. One evening we caught a taxi after the obligatory drink or 2 in Raffles back to the hotel which only cost S$7 (about £3.50) Please bear in mid we were told that after midnight taxi fares increase by 50% Food - We only ate breakfast at the hotel. I honestly could not fault the food. They catered for a wide variety of nationalities. Fruit, cereals, full cooked American type breakfast, fish and more Asian orintated breakfasts. Food was always of a good standard, we found. Room - We were upgraded to the next type up fromt he basic and it had everything we could need in a bedroom. A comfortable bed; a good bathroom; even a mini bar (which the fridge came in handy for our own bottled water). We overlooked the pool from the 15th floor. Not exactly a view, but we were there to explore the city, not look out of a window. The Brass Bar - we had a few drinks in the bar. Usually a quick drink afer being out in the day before heading up to get changed for the evening out. Staff were friendly, but as usual - drinkis in hotels are quite expensive. We did stumble on happy hour from about 3pm where selected drinks were BOGOF. One afternoon we heard a rather talented young man rehearsing with his keyboard and singing a bit. On our last night we vetured in for our last cocktail in Singapore. It was an experience all of its own. Turns out the talented man takes a back seat to 2 ladies who sing and dance - at least I think thats what they were doing :o) It's definitely worth a look. Overall, it's only a 3* hotel but we were more than pleased with it. If total luxury in a hotel based holiday is what you are after then you need to spend more. If Singpaore is what you are there to see then I'd say this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Our floor was stinky”
Reviews.Author: tourister89
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a period of about 4 days. The hotel was a decent place to stay in. One thing I felt was the swimming pool area was not well kept. The pool looked great but at the same time the area was deserted! We stayed in the 9th or the 10th floor (I don't remember exactly). The floor smelt as if it hadn't been accessed for months. It kind of smelt stale! Otherwise, the location was good. We came to Singapore for roaming around the place. We would be out the entire day and return only at night. So for our purpose, I felt it was unnecessarily too expensive. We could have settled for a cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but a revamp is overdue.”
Reviews.Author: elporko
Reviews.Content: Nice location, an easy walk Clarke Quay along the river, or catch the #51 bus to Chinatown MRT. Service is excellent along with a nice lobby. Alas the rooms are well overdue a revamp. the 6 of us (3 couples) were given a king room, a queen room and a double room, but at least they were on the same floor. The world's slowest elevators are also part of the package. We spent a week here and survived so it can't be all that bad. Adequate. Could be a really excellent hotel with a bit of work, but there are nicer hotels for the same price around.

Reviews.Title: “Good, except for the shuttle bus”
Reviews.Author: Charnwood-traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at nthis hotel for 3 nights on the way to Australia. We had a room on a high floor facing the rear which was nice and quiet. We found all the staff very helpful and polite. The restaurant is open for long hours and we found it more than adequate for our needs with a range of food that suited us. Everywhere appeared to be clean. There is a swimming pool at the rear of the hotel which is useful for relaxation, cooling down or keeping fit! The bar area is subjected to live music in the evening which was loud and not to our taste We used the free shuttle bus a couple of times and quickly learnt that it doesn't run to time, or anwhere near it. Once we got to the Clarke Quay/Chinatown stop 10 minutes before it was due to go just in time to see it vanishing in the distance. As it was raining we were not best pleased! The Management took our complaint most seriously and we even received a letter from them on our return to the UK.. This bus is operated jointly with several other hotels so the Miramar does not have direct control which is a pity. The hotel is not as isolated as it may appear to the first time visitor, a reasonably good walker can easily reach the Clarke Quay and China Town areas .. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: awsculli
Reviews.Content: We were in Singapore for two nights en-route to Australia and got the Miramar through British Airways web site. It is in a fairly remote location so you need to get cabs anywhere apart from Clark's Quay which was a 20 minute walk away. Room was of a typical hotel standard, with all necessary amenities, and was nice and quiet. Hotel pool was good but quite difficult to get to and from. Breakfast was not included in our rate, and was acceptable but nothing special. Would not recommend for more than one or two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Miramar!”
Reviews.Author: madiba_magic
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Miramar from the 13th December till the 17th. The Hotel was superb to allow us early check in as our flight arrived at 05h30 and we got to the hotel at about 07h00. The staff was amazing and nothing was too much trouble for them. After hearing people moan about the smelly rooms we made sure to request a non smokers room, which we were gladly given. The non smoking rooms had twin beds which wasn't a problem for us since they were at least comfortable firm beds. The rooms do have an odd smell, but I think it's because of the humidity and the aircons that are on whole day. I quite liked the location since being booked on a Singapore Stopover holiday we were allowed free access onto the hop on hop off buses, which conveniently stopped on our doorstep. The hotel is quite a distance from the nearest MRT, which is Chinatown I think, probably a good 15-20 minute walk, but that's not a issue since the hotel offers a free shuttle service to Orchard road and Chinatown so not necessary to walk in the humidity. All in all we had an awesome time in Singapore and the Miramar stay was most enjoyable, we would definitely reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey City”
Reviews.Author: Oliver9
Reviews.Content: First allocated room smelt strongly of cigarettes, so asked for another. First impression was better, larger, clean and sweet smelling, (out of the frying pan into the fire) After going for a walk and something to eat we returned to our room to catch up on some much needed sleep as we had been travelling for 14 hours. This proved to be impossible as right underneath our room, workmen were refurbishing; hammering, drilling and sawing. We phoned the reception but were told there was no other room, my husband then went down to reception only to be met by other couples looking for a room move because of the noise. All we were told was they would be finishing soon. We decided to get a sunbed around the pool and try to sleep there, not very comfortable. Apart from this the hotel was located well, the staff were very friendly and the lounge bar had good entertainment. The drinks were extortionate but found this to be the case in most places we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality”
Reviews.Author: Bristraveler
Reviews.Content: Due to a travel agent error was originally booked into the Allson hotel for the return stay with the Singapore Airlines Stopover deal. After a wait the staff there arranged an 'upgrade' to the Miramar hotel for us. Was very impressed despite on arrival the bellhop took our bags to our room to find the maid still making it, after an arguement between the 2 and a call to the front desk he had us wait on that floor, went downstairs, picked up our new room key, came and got us and took us to our room. An easy mistake but it was handled really well by the staff. The room was large clean and possibly had one of the most effective air conditioners i've experienced, the room was just like a freezer, which in my opinion for a hotel especially in Singapore is a good thing. Hotel was fantastic in my opinion, clean, comfortable bed and nice shower. Only thing that did let it down a little say compared to the Allson would have been location, but overall would definately recommend the place, especially as part of the Singapore Airlines stopover deals. Word of advice if your flight leaves really late, take the late checkout option, gives you the option to have a relax in your room and a nice shower before flying out, costs a few extra $$ but definately worth it especially with the heat and humidity.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: CheshireHolidaymaker
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel for a three day stopover on the way to austrailia. the hotel was a good chice for this as itv was close to clarke quay and boat quay.whilst it was a little walk to metro it did not put us off. the hotel was excellent good size rooms very clean and staff most helpful. the curtesy room was most welcome for late flights after booking out.a good chice for a stapover.recommended

Reviews.Title: “Surprised To See A Bad Review of Miramar.”
Reviews.Author: worzelle
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised to see a bad review of The Miramar Hotel,especially as it was from only a few weeks before we were there. We have stayed at the Miramar three times since 2004.[We previously stayed at the Allson Hotel and Crown Prince Hotel and were unhappy with them both] A work friend had been to the Miramar and recommended it and we have not been anywhere else since. We are always part of a Singapore Airlines Stopover and always stay one night each way on our way to Sydney to see our son.On the way home we have a whole day to visit Singapore before we are picked up in the evening to fly home.Being in a sticky,humid climate all day a shower is needed and although Miramar do have a free late check-out[around 15.00 hours]they also provide two courtesy rooms for use after check-out.Conciege will also safely look after your luggage.Both the Allson and Crown Prince wanted to charge an extremely large amount for a late check-out.We refused to pay at The Crown Prince and were made to have a shower in the old fashioned swimming pool changing rooms at the top of the hotel!! We did not like the staff attitude at all. Miramar staff are lovely,as are most of the Singapore people we have met.On our previous visit[2007] we had not booked a table in the restaurant after our day out sightseeing.People were being turned away as it was full but after we explained we were being picked up fairly soon for our flight home,they shuffled some tables and found us a spot. The Miramar bar has a[2 for1] happy hour which is great especially as drinks are so pricey in Singapore.[food not that expensive] They usually have singers in the bar and I have to say Simon Cowell would not be too happy with them ,but that is a very small gripe and doesn't detract from the excellant,friendly Miramar.

Reviews.Title: “Most Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: newtravellerSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We used this site to find a good hotel to stay in as a stopover to Sydney. Judging from the reviews we felt this sounded as good as any. We can honestly say that we were not disappointed. We found the hotel clean, atmostphere pleasant and staff extemely helpful. We ate in the restaurant and the food was very good and reasonably priced. We stayed for two days on our way out and were fortunate to be upgraded to an executive room and one night on our return. On a few reviews some people complained that they were put in a "musty smelling" room - we had one on our way back but it is in the old part of the hotel and "musty" is old! The room was clean and had all facilities to make an overnight stay comfortable. The hotels was well placed for the Quays and easily walkable to Raffles for the Singaport Sling! They also had a hote "hopper" bus to take you to China Town etc. All in all an extremely enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Miramar”
Reviews.Author: jooliem2001
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Singapore Airlines Stopover Holidays. We had one night booked to have a rest between flights from London to Auckland. Our flight arrived at 8am and check-in time wasn't until 2pm. However, we went to the hotel at 10am on the off-chance they would let us check in early and they did - didn't even have to ask, they had already allocated us a room early and with extended check-out time too. It was a smoking room, only evidenced by the ashtray, the room did not smell of smoke at all. The bed was firm and comfortable. Good night sleep and feel refreshed for our next flight.

Reviews.Title: “Very kind people here”
Reviews.Author: 1_D
Reviews.Content: We arrived absolutely shattered after a much delayed flight and twenty-one hours on a plane; the lovely, sympathetic hotel staff immediately upgraded us to a HUGE room with a palatial bathroom and let us have a very late check-out. The food in the hotel restaurant was good and the whole experience was very soothing!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel ,”
Reviews.Author: monaVictoria
Reviews.Content: We asked for a non smoking room and the one we got was spotlessly clean,very quiet. Room service was prompt. Travel pick up to and from Airport was very efficient. Just one negative point the lift always smelt of stale cigarette smoke. We would defiantly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: gbn
Reviews.Content: Three-night stay in September 2008 for a conference elsewhere in town, at the negotiated conference rate of S$250/night, booked directly with the hotel. The hotel was so-so, probably 3 stars for the hotel room and 4 for the open spaces, and 2 for the recreational facilities. They had one of the most pathetic gyms I've ever seen in a hotel: a treadmill and 3 weight machines in a room that was about 8 by 12 feet. Strangely, it was only open from 7a-7p, despite being unmanned. The outdoor pool was small, open 7a-7p, with no hot tub. They had some sort of spa on site, but I didn't visit it. The hotel's two main elevators were incredibly slow, and several nights there was room service refuse left in the halls all night. Internet costs S$28 per 24 hours for wireless, which was way too much. The morning breakfast buffet was generous, and had some good vegetarian/vegan offerings. It was included with my S$250 room rate. My room had two twin beds, basic furnishings, a hot pot with instant coffee and a small tea selection, and no alarm clock. Basic cable TV. Clean, and not uncomfortable, but far from posh.

Reviews.Title: “Miramar Riverside, good location,excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Aussietravellers27
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days at Miramar. Found staff to be of high standards. Nothing was a problem for them,even local information regarding tours and prices at marketsand bus times and which one to catch. Restuarant served good food and catered for locals as well as fussy Aussies.Buffet breakfast was great. The 2 complaints I had was: 1/ the bed was too hard for me,[but I like soft beds] a lot would find it great. 2/ There were black long[not short and curly] hairs everywhere in bathroom[as bathroom was white it was easy to see] and in a tea cup.After that I rinsed cup out with boiling water before using. I had used the teaspoon to eat a cream[chocolate]cake and that afternoon could see smears of cream residue on spoon as if it had been wiped with a cloth. There was a reveiw in 60 minutes regarding [in Assie 5 star] hotel cleaners of rooms .This program made me aware of what cleaners actually clean and what they use to clean !I always thought they replaced cups and glasses everyday but it doesnt appear so. I believe it must happens in most hotels worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: tranquilnight
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel to use as a Singapore stopover for a few nights then the Miramar is value for money and worth considering. The rooms are small and although we were told that there was room for an additional bed for our daughter we felt cramped. An attempt to update the bathroom with chrome, mirrors and downlighters has been successful. There was a strange fusty smell in our room, which we think was caused by the combination of airconditioning, lack of ventilation and fitted carpets getting damp. We used the shuttle bus to get in and out of the city, but found the taxi service cheap and reliable, apart from Sunday night when there seemed to be a distinct shortage of taxis in Orchard Road. There is a small gym close to the pool which says it is open 7.00a.m. but can actually be accessed at all hours with your room key. Yes I know this sounds sad, but when jet lag hits in the early hours of the morning there's not much else to do! The swimming pool looks unloved, but is very quiet, there are plenty of towels and it's a nice place to visit in the late afternoon. Breakfasts were part of our deal, and were fine. Plenty of coffee, and the usual self service choices. I think that we would have looked for alternatives if we had to pay the $19 cost. We particularly appreciated the hospitality rooms which we used before our early evening flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a short visit to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: lecturemusic
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Oz with Singapore as a three day stopover at the Miramar Hotel. Hotel very clean and staff most attentive. Nothing too much trouble. The Room was on a high floor with excellent views of the river and every facility. The hotel is within walking distance of the main shopping plazas,Chinatown & the River. Use the Metro to visit further afield such as Little India. Great food and sights. Raffles is a bit disappointing now as it is dominated by shopping arcades. Visit Sentosa by Cable car, you could spend a day here, although lots of building going on for the new casino. The shopping plazas have some good deals for afternoon tea if you want to get out of the heat. The Hotel Swimming Pool could do with a bit of updating, but a welcome break after a day sightseeing. Breakfast, if you took it ,was fair value for money and there were not many cafes that near as an alternative. Only one adverse comment on the hotel. Use of the Internet was 10 dollars, but 1 dollar to use a piece of paper for printing. That would be S$500 for a ream..what about that for a profit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: t08
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great value, excellent shower, comfortable beds, excellent breakfast included in price. Free shutle bus but taxis are so cheap that location is fine

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Typhoon21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped at the Miramar mid-April as a stopover on the way back to the UK from Borneo. As a stopover hotel this establishment was adequate for our needs. Clean room, firm bed, good hot shower, tea and coffee in the room etc. We had a Premier room with a crazy coloured carpet (see pictures on the website). I can't go into to much detail about this place as we weren't there very long but, the pool area is overlooked by two or three tall hotel blocks and didn't feel very inviting. The hotel itself is clean and we were treated well by the staff. There is a bar next to the lobby which has karaoke. I went in briefly to look at the cocktails menu after a trip to the night safari (I will add a review for this soon). I didn't stay in the bar long as the song that was being murdered was being sung at a volume that made my ears bleed. I can't comment on the food either as we left at 6am next morning and didn't sample the breakfast. Location wise, the hotel doesn't seem to be close to anything really. We had a fifteen minute walk down to the World City shopping centre, and it isn't close to the MRT either. Overall, this hotel is good for a stopover but I would not use it as a base for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for stopover visit”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine100
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews of this hotel, we were a little apprehensive. However, for a stopover hotel it is more than adequate. We stayed there for 2 nights in two interconnecting rooms which our young children thought were fab - our daugther particularly appreciated the slippers and dressing gown (adult sized but she didn't care!). The rooms were a reasonable size and the hotel staff were very helpful. It is some distance from Singapore central but this really isn't a problem - taxis are amazingly cheap. If you do visit with young kids, we recommend the Night Safari (fantastic place and ideal to do if you've arrived at night after a very long plane journey with kids that think it's morning - a visit here will wear them out enough to then sleep through the night). The zoo is also wonderful and not too large - the water play area was much appreciated. Sentosa island is also worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from MRT: othewise OK”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: While Singapore is undoubtedly the most plastic and boring place in Asia, this inadequacy is partly made up by its excellent MRT and reasonable bus systems. Unfortunately the Miramar is too far from the MRT: it ia a good 15 minute walk and as I found on a Sunday morning when dragging a suitcase, a Westerner rapidly becomes sweaty. The room was fine with no external noise evident. It was sufficiently dark during the night. Breakfast was adequate though lacking the sophistication evident in some Filipino hotel breakfasts. Bu then again this is Singapore, and many first time travellers come here so mediocrity tends to rule. All in all, fine for a short stopover but for a longer stay, a hotel closer to an MRT station would be preferable.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beamoSuttonColdfield
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the Miramar for 3 nights following stays in KL and Penang.My party included wife and 16 year old daughter and 12 year old son. We were directed to 2 rooms on the 13th floor that were smoking rooms which we immediately rejected. We were relocated to rooms 907 and 909 in the main block.The rooms were adequate but required refurbishment as they were tired.Apparently the rooms in the more modern wing are better and housed China Airlines personnel. There were only 2 lifts which made for a lot of waiting time,breakfast was fine although hetic and the weekend compared to week mornings.Happy hour 4-8 in the bar was a bonus. The hotel was a 15 minute walk to the nearest MRT station at Chinatown or Clarkes Quay,taxi $3/5 SPD was a better option due to the heat.,ensure you take a metered Cab. We did all the tourist attractions but despite being spotless Singapore lacked character and was expensive. We went to Chinatown,Little India (avoid on a Sunday it is busier than Calcutta!!!),Raffles,The Zoo and Santosa (What an awful experience that was) Santosa is undergoing major development making the Cable Car ride in from Mount Faber a dusty experience!!.The beaches and Coves look better from the air and indeed when we reached them were not useable due to oil pollution. I cannot see how the authorities can allow this to have been developed so close to a major shipping lane,the place the attractions are totally manufactured and expensive,please do not waste your time or money visiting

Reviews.Title: “A good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights en route to Australia. Our room was fine and we particularly enjoyed the buffet dinners and breakfasts in the restaurant. The staff were very helpful. The hotel is maybe a little remote, but the free shuttle bus worked well and if it had been a little less humid we could probably have walked further. There were always taxis available. The pool area was a little neglected but we did have an enjoyable swim one evening. There were no pool towels but on ringing some were brought up immediately. We had an early departure and were pleasantly surprised to have full breakfast facilities available at 5am. All in all a good base when on a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: kalmy1961
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of Feb.We did not like it at all. Our first impression was "How Nice' but then we got to our room!!!!,,we were given a room with 2 single beds..hubby wasnt impressed..but on top of that it was a smoking room and absolutely stunk of cigarette smoke.There was no clock or radio either. The breakfast was only passable.I didnt like the location as it was further away from chinatown than we expected.I wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Canadian079
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights in early January 2008. This hotel is located about a 20 minute walk from the nearest subway stop, which is a bit further than what we were told by the hotel staff prior to our arrival. Clark’s Quay is about a 20 minute walk along the river and it is not much further to the Colonial district. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus to the shopping district and China town and it is possible to catch the bus for a return trip as long as you meet the bus at the same stop. We enjoyed our time in this hotel. We found the reception staff very helpful. The room was large, with nice amenities, such as an in-room safe, coffee and tea service and hair dryer. The room was very clean with complete bathroom amenities. The hotel was quiet even though it was very busy. On our last morning we needed to leave very early. Breakfast was available to us (all except the eggs) at 5 a.m. This was a nice surprise since we thought we would be given a box breakfast. Most of the buffet was available even though it was before usual opening time. This service was greatly appreciated. Even though the location is somewhat far from the public transportation we enjoyed the walks along the riverfront. Restaurants were within walking distance from the hotel. We would recommend this hotel while staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: Steve2008London
Reviews.Content: Booked via SingaporeAir re their Singapore stopover deals, price ok, chose hotel from second tier group in SingaporeAir list of hotels based on usual photos and proximity to the MRT train network. However the map on the hotels web site was a bit elastic with the truth re the positioning of the hotel to the nearest station which appeared to be maybe 500 metres away at most, however was around 1500 meters which is a long way in 30degree heat and high humidity. Ordered a double bed but got a twin, nice bathroom, room no better than cheaper 3* hotels. Pool nice but not enough seats and towels always running out, staff not keen to help on that one due to not getting the tips they recieve from bar sales. Pool changing rooms also filthy, hadnt been cleaned in months by the look of it. Did not eat in hotel so cant comment, probably wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “had a very comfortable stay here”
Reviews.Author: nanabren
Reviews.Content: Our friends and ourselves stayed here in October on the way to NZ and also on the way back in December. We had very comfortable, clean rooms both times. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel was in a good location - a short walk to Clarke Quay but far enough away from the centre of things so that it wasn't noisy. The Singapore Airlines hop-on/hop off bus stopped right outside the hotel, (make sure you keep your airline baggage check ticket in order to get an all day ticket for 3 dollars rather than the normal 12 dollars), and the hotel also has a free bus into the main area of town going about three times per day - so transport couldn't be easier. Taxis are also incredibly cheap. The cafeteria was good value for money especially at breakfast but evening meals were the same choice every day so it tended to get a bit boring. Drinks in the bar tended to be on the expensive side. Do not miss the Botanic Gardens (free) (and the free bus stops outside) and do go to Sentosa Island and also visit Chinatown. We booked our first stay at the hotel through a travel agent in UK but decided not to book the second stay until we had been and tried it. We obviously liked it and tried to book our second stay just before we left. We were amazed that the price quoted by the hotel was almost twice the amount we had paid through the travel agent in UK. The hotel actually advised us to ring UK and book again through our travel agent, which we did and even got it slightly cheaper than our first stay!! Singapore is lovely but make sure you have a small brolly with you at all times!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: photomart
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Service By the Hotel. Room 100% clean , Food in Hotel was outsatnding good Prices. even more pleasing was China Town was only short walk 15mins. Little India was short Taxi Ride. infac we was so pleased we are rebooking for 2008 but staying longer on stop Back from NZ .

Reviews.Title: “really helpful stopover”
Reviews.Author: topgearNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a stopover for 36 hours. The staff really couldn't have been more helpful and we really felt that we had relaxed and been able to rest between flights. We arrived at 8.30 am and were allowed to use a hospitality room to shower and change in. When we emerged from there intending to store our luggage for the day until our room was available, we were told that our room was all ready for us which was great. The breakfast wasn't up to much and was expensive but we were tired so we ate there anyway. The shuttle bus for Singapore Stopovers stops right outside the hotel which was great. It wasn't so easy to find the stops along Orchard Rd though and we ended up getting a taxi back to the hotel. The taxis were so cheap though that I used them a few times after that. It was better than waiting for a bus in the heat when we were tired. We checked out the following morning, having enjoyed the pool, and left our luggage stored for the day. We were told we could have a late check-out anyway of 2.30 but we wanted to go sight-seeing. When we arrived back at the hotel about 6.30 pm it was possible to prepare for the flight by using the hospitality room again. The hotel was extremely good value, booked with Singapore Airways as part of their stopover service. I really felt we had excellent value for money. I was travelling with my son and could have felt vulnerable in a strange city but I felt quite safe and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very average indeed”
Reviews.Author: Commodore
Reviews.Content: The room was large and comfortable, but I was not otherwise terribly impressed with this place. Poor location, officious staff and a restaurant that looked more like a military cafeteria than a hotel restaurant all contributed to a distinctly unmemorable hotel experience. Suffice it to say, I won't be rushing back here.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: nikitaScotland
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at The Hotel Miramar Singapore for 3 nights on our way home from Australia. This hotel was ok but would not recommend it ? My travel agent told me it was in the process of being upgraded and there was a new wing finished so obviously I asked for this in my booking. We did not get this wing and the hotel is a little on the shabby side. The air conditioning machine ran all night it can't be switched off not neccessary all night as room was quite cool, if you don't request a room at the back of the hotel it is very noisey at the front no double glazing and very busy main road outside. On a positive side good value for a few nights, they did give us breakfast for three days free and a complimentary newspaper ! Singapore was amazing and the hotel is only some where to put your head for the night !

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location - Bad room”
Reviews.Author: huow
Reviews.Content: ==== Location The hotel is located on Havelock rd. Actually it is a bad location as it far from many things and the most important: far from a MRT station. It takes me 20 min walk to reach Chinatown station. One will have to take the bus or the taxi instead. ==== Room I was given room #1426. It is a basic room with twin beds. The room is dark even during day time. A/C does't work well: I had to set the A/C down to 15°C to get a convenient temperature! Carpet is old and used. And the room smells, I think its comes from the used carpet. Although I do not suffer from any allergy I had some trouble to breathe. ==== Staff Staff is polite but I had only a few contact with them and only at the reception desk. ==== Bottomlines From outside the hotel seems to be a good mid-range hotel. But for me it is not. I would consider it as a budget hotel due to the poor quality of my room. But for 74 EUR a night (SIA holliday stopover program) it is too expensive for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job but not our best choice!”
Reviews.Author: MrsKP
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel purely because our travel agent recommended it as they had a special deal on at the time. Having read the reviews we requested a room in the new part of the hotel but I don't think we got one. The location was OK, further from the airport than other hotels we stayed in, but cabs are cheap so not really a problem. Although it was about a 10 minute walk to Clarke Quay and Chinatown its a walk along a busy 3 lane highway so not exactly pleasant. The room itself was fine - bed was hard though - but that seems typical of Singapore. No BBC World on the TV. One thing that was very strange was that the curtains did not cover the whole window, they literally pulled across a third each side leaving the middle bare (with a net), we had an early flight so it wasn't too much of a problem but if you don't like light rooms in the morning this would be annoying. We didn't visit the bar but weren't exactly inspired from the singing we could hear.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good”
Reviews.Author: KIKiwi3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice - the first time for 3 nights, then we went to Bintan Island, and then came back for 2 nights. Overall the staff are friendly and helpful. Our package included breakfast each day and that was wonderful (in fact we didn't need lunch!). The first 3 nights we were in the older part and that was just ok. The rooms were adequate, bathroom ok but the bed was very hard. When we came back we were in the newer part and that was lovely. The bed was softer and the bathroom very nice. We also found the swimming pool & surrounds nice & relaxing after being out in the heat. Another good feature of this hotel is that if you have a late flight out they will store your luggage & also, after spending the day out and about they have a small lounge & bathroom where you can have a shower, etc before you leave for the airport. This was great as after a day in the Singapore heat you definitely need it! The hotel is about a 10min walk to the nearest underground station at Chinatown and the garage next door has grocery items available if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Location not great”
Reviews.Author: flossieChristchurch
Reviews.Content: We booked into this Hotel as there were no rooms (apart from very expensive ones) in the area we normally stay in. The staff at Reception were very good, as were the men who handled the luggage, called taxis etc. The room was of a reasonable size, but could have been cleaner. I noted stains on a hard backed chair, and stains on the blue decoration pillows on the beds. Vacuuming had not done properly as there was a line of dust all along the edge of the carpet in front of the wardrobe. The room and bathroom were a little shabby, but nothing a coat of paint could not fix. There was plenty of shampoo , hand soaps and also toothbrushes , which not many hotels provide. Sheets and towels were changed every day. The location for us was most inconvenient, but with such cheap taxis, it was not a problem to hop into one whenever we wanted to go anywhere. I cannot agree that it is a 5 minute walk to the night life of Clarke Quay - it is a lot further than 5 minutes walk away. I don't think I would stay here again, but mainly because of the location. .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: CjT6
Reviews.Content: We checked in at Hotel Miramar at around 1am. The receptionist were accomodating. When booking for a hotel, always note that you want the room IN THE NEW BUILDING. Those who hate the Miramar Hotel prolly stayed at the old building. I read here in trip advisor to request for a room in the new building. I did and we stayed in this clean and good room. It was being cleaned everyday. Here is what I like about the Hotel: 1. Clean room and complete amenities. 2. The pool was great. Not much people so it was ok and we enjoyed the good view. 3. We had a free breakfast. The breakfast buffet was awesome and complete. 4. The people who works at Miramar ARE EXCELLENT AND ACCOMODATING. 5. They have a free shuttle service to Orchard Road and Chinatown. 6. All the cab drivers know Miramar Hotel. 7. You can ask for the adapator (plugs) at the receptionist. 8. We missed this one, but they have a bar downstairs. 9. The hotel is right next to a gasoline station and they have a convenience store. 10. The Hotel is situated in a peaceful and beautiful area. 11. You can walk to Chinatown and Clarke Quay (long walk). 12. There is a bus stop in front of the hotel and many taxis are waiting outside the hotel. 13. There is also a souvenir shop near the staircase. The shirts and biscuits are way cheaper than those at Sentosa. The price of the souvenirs are excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal stopover hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SandNDevon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Miramar for a 3 night stopover on our way to Australia. Having read some of the previous reviews we were very pleasantly surprised. We had an upgraded room, through booking early. It was spacious, very clean and comfortable, bed and bedding excellent. The bathroom was also clean with all amenities. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. The swimming pool was a relaxing spot after a morning's sightseeing. The breakfast was very good, lots of choices. We had a snack on our arrival evening and one evening meal in the restaurant, both of which were good. The location is close to the river, a short stroll from Clark Quay, where there are numerous restaurants. We were very impressed with Singapore, its cleanliness and the friendly people. The trips we did (which can be booked from the hotel) were excellent, and a Singapore Sling at Raffles is a must! From our experience we would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Some Trick photography in the advertising”
Reviews.Author: fidsboy
Reviews.Content: The main saving graces of this hotel are the helpful and friendly staff and the fact the windows open to let the smell out!! I burst out laughing when I saw the gym, it is a converted closet and is so small the treadmill has to be put on an angle to fit. I've had two broken TV sets in a row (Maybe a rock band stayed there before me).

Reviews.Title: “was okay”
Reviews.Author: snaidu
Reviews.Content: Location of Hotel Miramar is very good ,very near to all shopping centres ,staff were freindly. Overall was not satisfyied with the conditions of the rooms. The rooms needed a good clean up,and needs new beddings. I would not rate it as a 3.5 or 4 star Hotel as it says on the net.
